source: be gone!
target: scram!

source: never so pleased,sir.
target: couldn’t be happier, sir.

source: theres beggary in the love that can be reckoned.
target: love that you can count on is broke.

source: didst not thou share?
target: didn’t you chip in?

source: precious villain!
target: what a sneaky jerk!

source: tis thou,and those,that have dishonoured me.
target: it’s you and your crew who dissed me.

source: and begged he pardon?
target: and did he beg for forgiveness?

source: no epilogue,i pray you;for your play needs no excuse.
target: no need for an epilogue, please; your show’s already solid.

source: falstaff,good night.
target: falstaff, good night.

source: she says your worship means to make a puppet of her.
target: she says you plan to turn her into your puppet.

source: his head is off,and sent to angelo.
target: his head’s been chopped off and shipped to angelo.

source: put me in thy books.
target: add me to your good list.

source: out upon him!
target: ugh, get him outta here!

source: for aught that i could ever read,could ever hear by tale or history,the course of true love never did run smooth.
target: from everything i’ve read or heard, true love’s path is never easy.

source: tis not his new-made bride shall succour him;and as for clarence,as my letters tell me,hes very likely now to fall from him for matching more for wanton lust than honour,or than for strength and safety of our country.
target: his new bride won’t save him; and clarence, my letters say, might ditch him soon for chasing lust over honor or what’s best for our country.

source: let her alone.
target: leave her be.

source: then,that in all you writ to rome,or else to foreign princes,ego et rex meuswas still inscribed,in which you brought the king to be your servant.
target: so in all your letters to rome or foreign rulers, you signed ‘ego et rex meus,’ basically making the king your servant.

source: upon my life,my lord,ill undertake it;and so god give you quiet rest tonight.
target: i swear, my lord, i’ll handle it; now god bless you with a peaceful night.

source: now,noble charmian,well dispatch indeed,and when thou hast done this chare,ill give thee leave to play till doomsday.
target: now, noble charmian, let’s get this done; once you’re finished, you’re free to chill forever.
